threats.label: Purchase Order - Keylogger
threats.executiveSummary: These e-mails attempt to disguise themselves as orders with PO attached. The attachment is a .zip archive containing a Windows executable file, a malware of the keylogger family. When executed, the file will create a hidden process, as well as drop a persistent file that starts up on every system's restart. The keylogger will then collect sensitive information and exfiltrate it to the threat actors via e-mail.

threats.label: Order - OfficeMacro, Zeus Panda
threats.executiveSummary: These emails claim to deliver information pertaining to an order and request that recipients view the attached file. The attachment is an .xls Microsoft Excel spreadsheet containing a malicious Office macro tasked with downloading and executing a sample of the Zeus Panda banking trojan. At runtime, this malware application performs extensive checks to determine if it is running in a virtualized or analysis environment before making contact with its command and control host. Once contact has been established, this host will provide additional instructions, updated executables, and configuration data used to guide the financial crimes and botnet trojan's activity on infected machines. In this case the configuration data contained a list of targeted websites including PayPal, Poste Italiane, and the banking websites for Intesa san Paolo and Monte dei Paschi di Siena.

malwareFamilySet.description: Advanced derivative of the Zeus financial crimes and botnet trojan
